name: Food Court 1
desc: MIT’s OG food hub, air-conditioned glory. People rave about non-veg days (Mon, Wed, Fri), but veg options? Meh. Opposite Student Plaza, it’s central—Rs. 177/day. Monotonous menu, yet the vibe’s unmatched.

name: Food Court 2
desc: Downhill savior near 16-17. People love the month-end specials—gajar ka halwa slaps. No AC, hot as hell in summer, but cheap and tasty. Live counter burgers? Yes, please. Girls hate the trek, though.

name: Adithya Mess
desc: Boys-only, between Blocks 5-6. People say it’s homely—varied breakfast, non-veg thrice weekly. No AC, sweaty misery in even semesters. Close to hostels, but academic hike sucks.

name: Annapoorna Mess
desc: Co-ed, near 9-10. People dig the home-cooked feel—non-veg Tue/Thu/Sat. No AC, long walk for girls. Breakfast variety’s a win, but summer heat turns it into a sauna.

name: Apoorva Mess
desc: Block 8’s buddy, co-ed chaos. People love the Oreo milkshake and a la carte—pasta, Maggi, delivered till 11 PM. Non-AC, packed, weekly menu changes. Outdoor seating’s a vibe.

name: Sindhi Mess
desc: Co-ed spot near Block 10, People say it’s a hidden gem—simple, Sindhi-style meals with dal-chawal staples. Non-veg rare, no AC, but cheap and filling. Five-minute walk to academics, summer heat’s a killer.
